p: As ACE-2 is the binding site for SARS CoV-2, its blockade is thought to be beneficial in preventing/treating this infection. A retrospective analysis showed reduced rates of death and endotracheal intubation in patients with viral pneumonia who were continued on ACE inhibitors [ 21]. Mice with coronavirus induced lung injury showed improvement when treated with an angiotensin receptor blocker, losartan [ 22].As far as CVID-19 infection is concerned, the data on RAS activation or the effect of its blockadeis limited at present. Hypokalaemia and hypertension? could be a marker of RAS activation and high incidence of hypokalaemia has been reported in patients with COVID-19 infection [ 23].
